text: Turkish Civil Law, also known as Turk Medeni Kanunu, is the fundamental civil code of Turkey. Article 1 states that every person has legal capacity from birth until death. This means all individuals have fundamental rights and legal responsibilities. Article 2 requires everyone to act in good faith when exercising their rights. Good faith is a cornerstone principle of Turkish civil law. Article 3 declares that manifest bad faith is not protected by law. The law was adopted in 1926 based on the Swiss Civil Code.
title: Turkish Civil Law Summary
